attributes.additional_details: AI is developing at unprecedented speed and is already shaping jobs, public services, and the information we see online. Without strong oversight, it risks enabling fraud, spreading misinformation, making biased decisions, and causing real harm to people and society. Current laws are not keeping pace. An independent regulator with legal powers is urgently needed to ensure AI in the UK is developed and used safely, fairly, and with full accountability.
attributes.background: Create an independent UK regulator with legal powers to set AI safety standards, require testing before release, hold companies liable for harm, monitor AI for fraud, bias, and misinformation, enforce penalties, and publish public reports on risks and compliance.

rejection.details:
The following petitions call for similar actions: 

Establish the AI Security Institute as a statutory body
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/724156

Hold an urgent Citizens’ Assembly on AI and enact its recommendations 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/716823

Introduce a tax on AI usage & modify AI regulation to help UK jobs & workers
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/721480
